page.title: 10A SOIL SAMPLE EXPERIMENT
page.content: (AIM) To test Arthur Young's ideas on soil in Collier Row in 1807. (METHOD) We got a spade and went to the garden. We dug about 30cm. At first we found that the soil was loamy and we found fine particles of sand and gravel. When we dug a bit further down the soil started to get harder. When we dug the full length we found that it was completely solid and wet. It was tightly packed with clay. (RESULTS) We found that there are two types of soil in Collier Row:1)The top soil is loamy, 2) The bottom is clay. (CONCLUSION) The scientist Arthur Young was right in saying that Collier Row had two types of soil as our test showed.
